text: Denis Mukengere Mukwege (;English pronunciation of Denis Mukwege. Retrieved 29 October 2014 born 1 March 1955) is a Congolese gynecologist. He founded and works in Panzi Hospital in Bukavu. He works in the treatment of women who have been gang-raped by rebel forces. He has treated thousands of women who were victims of gang wartime rape since the Second Congo War.Nolen, Stephanie. "Where repairing rape damage is an expertise," The Globe and Mail, October 22, 2008. In 2018, he and Nadia Murad were awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for "their efforts to end the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war and armed conflict." ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Physicians Category:Human rights activists Category:African writers Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo people Category:Gynecologists
title: Denis Mukwege
